intro: Coronopus pinnatifidus var. australis, commonly known as the Australian starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and heathlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
